    • Uses of Action in command

      Methods in command that return Action 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private Action CommandTable.convertKeyToAction(boolean pushA, boolean pushB, boolean pushC, Key nowKeyData, int[] commandList, State state, boolean isFront)
      引数として渡されたキー入力情報とキャラクター情報を基に, それに対応するアクションを返す.
      Action CommandTable.interpretationCommandFromKey(Character character, java.util.Deque<Key> input)
      P1またはP2のキー入力データを対応するアクションに変換する処理を行い，そのアクションを返す．
      このメソッドはシミュレータ内でのみ呼び出される.
      Action CommandTable.interpretationCommandFromKeyData(Character character, java.util.Deque<KeyData> input)
      P1またはP2のキー入力データを対応するアクションに変換する処理を行い，そのアクションを返す．
      P1とP2の判別は，キャラクターデータが持つプレイヤー番号によって行う．

    • Uses of Action in simulator

      Fields in simulator with type parameters of type Action 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Deque<Action>> SimFighting.inputActions
      入力されたアクション．
      Method parameters in simulator with type arguments of type Action 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void SimFighting.initialize(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Motion>> motionList, java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Deque<Action>> actionList, FrameData frameData, boolean playerNumber)
      初期化処理を行う．
      FrameData Simulator.simulate(FrameData frameData, boolean playerNumber, java.util.Deque<Action> myAct, java.util.Deque<Action> oppAct, int simulationLimit)
      Simulates the progression of a fight starting from a given FrameData instance and executing specified actions for both players.
      The resulting FrameData is returned, and can be used to assess the outcome of the simulation.
      Note that when the character is on ground, all AIR actions will be considered invalid by the simulator and all GROUND actions are considered invalid if the character is in air as well).
      To simulate AIR actions when the character is initially on ground, add Action.JUMP to the action list before the AIR action.
      For example, myAct.add(Action.JUMP); myAct.add(Action.AIR_A);
      FrameData Simulator.simulate(FrameData frameData, boolean playerNumber, java.util.Deque<Action> myAct, java.util.Deque<Action> oppAct, int simulationLimit)
      Simulates the progression of a fight starting from a given FrameData instance and executing specified actions for both players.
      The resulting FrameData is returned, and can be used to assess the outcome of the simulation.
      Note that when the character is on ground, all AIR actions will be considered invalid by the simulator and all GROUND actions are considered invalid if the character is in air as well).
      To simulate AIR actions when the character is initially on ground, add Action.JUMP to the action list before the AIR action.
      For example, myAct.add(Action.JUMP); myAct.add(Action.AIR_A);
